channel.title: MYB
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from MYB, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Apple Forced Into Drastic iPhone 16 Pro Downgrade
item.description: Apple is removing a key piece of software from some iPhone 16 and iPhone 16 Pro smartphones.

item.title: Bye now
item.description: The difference between ‘buy now’ and ‘bye now’ is very thin. Sometimes, when we push very hard for a commitment, we break the trust we’ve earned. For ...

item.title: Audio-Technica Announces New Stylus For Vinyl Enthusiasts
item.description: Venerable Japanese brand Audio-Technica has announced an affordable stylus upgrade for owners of the iconic Sound Burger AT-SB727/AT-SB2022 and AT-LP6...

item.title: Modern apologies
item.description: The AI driven voice mail system said, “I’m sorry, I didn’t understand you.” Of course, there is no “I” and by most definitions of sorry, it’s not. But...

item.title: Legendary FedEx CIO Rob Carter’s 25 Year Tenure As CIO Concludes
item.description: Perhaps the most admired CIO ever, Rob Carter of FedEx, recently retired. He offered some reflections on 25 years as the company's CIO during his last...

item.title: The hierarchy of insight
item.description: It looks like this: Which do we measure the most, spend the most obtaining and argue about most often? We might have it backwards. HT Russ Ackoff.

item.title: Adobe Unveils New Tools For Brands To Personalize And Measure AI Content
item.description: The Adobe Journey Optimizer and Adobe Experience Manager are two new tools that enable brands to personalize AI-generated content variations across ch...

item.title: Banana Equivalents
item.description: Bananas are (slightly) radioactive. The banana equivalent dose (BED) is a measurement of radiation. It’s definitely not enough to hurt you. When we th...

item.title: Life360 Announces New Range Of Tile Bluetooth Tracking Devices
item.description: Keep track of valuables and family with the new range of Tile Bluetooth trackers from Life360. The new range include SOS features which can alert emer...

item.title: Getting AI to do your work
item.description: That’s the first step, certainly. If you don’t, your boss will. The second step is to take the time you’ve freed up and do work that the AI can’t do.
